p: The metazoan ASV richness and diversity were higher than that recorded by morphotaxonomy (Tables 1 and 2), with both recording a higher richness and diversity in South Cove than Hangar Cove (Tables 1 and 2). Similar to the patterns for morphotaxonomy, the two coves were clearly separated from each other by metabarcoding (Fig. 3), with an average of 73% dissimilarity between the coves (ANOSIM). The main taxa responsible for these differences were nematodes (7 ASVs) and then rotifers (3 ASVs).
